intro: Taraxacum goloskokovii, commonly known as the Goloskokov's dandelion, is a perennial herbaceous plant belonging to the Asteraceae family. It is characterized by its rosette of basal, spoon-shaped leaves and a distinctive flowering head composed of numerous yellow florets. Native to Central Asia, this species thrives in arid and semi-arid environments, often found in steppes and rocky soils. Its flowers produce achene fruits with pappus, facilitating wind dispersal. The plant is notable for its adaptability to harsh climates and is of interest in botanical studies due to its unique ecological role.
